title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: Aging and reclusive Hollywood movie icon Evelyn Hugo is finally ready to tell the truth about her glamorous and scandalous life.

title: Fourth Wing
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: Twenty-year-old Violet Sorrengail was supposed to enter the Scribe Quadrant, but when she's ordered to join the riders, she's forced to face dragons.

title: Book Lovers
author: Emily Henry
description: Nora Stephens' life is books—she's read them all—and she is not that type of person who goes to North Carolina to fall in love.

title: The Atlas Six
author: Olivie Blake
description: The Alexandrian Society is a secret society of magical academicians, the foremost scholars of the occult arts.

title: The Spanish Love Deception
author: Elena Armas
description: Catalina Martín desperately needs a date to her sister's wedding, and her academic rival Aaron Blackford might be the perfect fake boyfriend.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: In the house of Helios, god of the sun and mightiest of the Titans, a daughter is born. But Circe is a strange child—not obviously beautiful, not obviously powerful.

title: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
author: V.E. Schwab
description: France, 1714: in a moment of desperation, a young woman makes a Faustian bargain to live forever—and is cursed to be forgotten by everyone she meets.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
author: TJ Klune
description: Linus Baker leads a quiet, solitary life. At forty, he lives in a tiny house with a devious cat and his old records.

title: The Priory of the Orange Tree
author: Samantha Shannon
description: A world divided. A queendom without an heir. An ancient enemy awakens. The House of Berethnet has ruled Inys for a thousand years.

title: Red Queen
author: Victoria Aveyard
description: Mare Barrow's world is divided by blood—those with common, Red blood serve the Silver-blooded elite, who are gifted with superhuman abilities.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death there is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever. Every book provides a chance to try another life you could have lived.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
description: Achilles, 'the best of all the Greeks,' son of the cruel sea goddess Thetis and the legendary king Peleus, is strong, swift, and beautiful—irresistible to all who meet him.
